main_definition: To fall or separate from a larger mass in small, individual units.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Decrease in volume or level gradually and steadily over time.
meanings_and_examples.example: Sales have been dropping for the past few months.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To fall suddenly from a higher place to a lower one.
meanings_and_examples.example: The apple dropped from the tree branch onto the ground.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A liquid substance that is emitted in small, individual units.
meanings_and_examples.example: She wiped away her tears with a tissue as they continued to drop down her cheeks.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To reduce or lessen the quantity of something gradually over time.
meanings_and_examples.example: The doctor advised me to cut back on caffeine, so I've been slowly dropping my daily intake.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A short phrase used figuratively in conversation that typically cannot be taken literally.
meanings_and_examples.example: When he said 'the show has dropped,' it meant the event was canceled.
